adjective.description: Of or appropriate to war; warlike.

proper noun.description: (c.40–c.AD 104), Roman epigrammatist, born in Spain; Latin name Marcus Valerius Martialis. His 15 books of epigrams, in a variety of meters, reflect all facets of Roman life.

origin: Late Middle English: from Old French, or from Latin martialis, from Mars, Mart- (see Mars).
